docs.lead_paragraph: Keila Merino finishes at the top of the pack in grueling 100-mile running races, but teaching in a poor Bronx school may be her greatest challenge.

headline.main: For a Teacher, Back-to-Back Marathons, Then Fourth-Graders
headline.print_headline: In It for the Long Run

docs.abstract: Keila Merino, one of nation's top ultramarathon runners, finds challenge of running equal to that of her job teaching underprivileged fourth-graders at Public School X114 in Bronx, where most students are poor, Hispanic and often still learning English.
docs.snippet: Keila Merino finishes at the top of the pack in grueling 100-mile running races, but teaching in a poor Bronx school may be her greatest challenge.

docs.lead_paragraph: A new study shows that both Republicans and Democrats want the government to help us behave well.

headline.main: When America Says Yes to Government
headline.print_headline: When America Says Yes to Government

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Cass R Sunstein describes results of survey of 563 people he conducted about how public reacts to soft interventions introduced by government, such as mandating disclosure of nutritional information at chain restaurants; notes that bipartisan majority of people surveyed approve of such measures.
docs.snippet: A new study shows that both Republicans and Democrats want the government to help us behave well.

docs.lead_paragraph: First lady Michelle Obama shares a chill-out playlist, a few family photos and a chat with actress Meryl Streep as guest editor of the July-August issue of More magazine.

headline.main: More Magazine Talks to Michelle Obama and Meryl Streep
headline.print_headline: More Magazine Talks to Michelle Obama and Meryl Streep

docs.snippet: First lady Michelle Obama shares a chill-out playlist, a few family photos and a chat with actress Meryl Streep as guest editor of the July-August issue of More magazine.

docs.lead_paragraph: Michelle Obama shared her dismay Friday over the killings of nine worshippers at a historic black church in the United States, telling American soldiers and their families based in Italy that she hopes such tragedies "will one day come to an end."

headline.main: Michelle Obama Recalls Charleston on Visit to US Base
headline.print_headline: Michelle Obama Recalls Charleston on Visit to US Base

docs.snippet: Michelle Obama shared her dismay Friday over the killings of nine worshippers at a historic black church in the United States, telling American soldiers and their families based in Italy that she hopes such tragedies "will one day come to an end."

docs.lead_paragraph: Sid Miller, the state’s new agriculture commissioner, says government mandates have failed to make children healthier in Texas, where roughly two-thirds of residents are considered overweight or obese.

headline.main: Texas: Deep Fryers, Once Banned by State, Are Allowed to Return to Public Schools
headline.print_headline: Texas: State to End Ban on Deep Fryers in Schools

docs.abstract: Texas Agriculture Commissioner Sid Miller announces end to decade-old ban on deep fried foods in public schools; move is considered unwelcome reversal by health advocates and school nutritionists.
docs.snippet: Sid Miller, the state’s new agriculture commissioner, says government mandates have failed to make children healthier in Texas, where roughly two-thirds of residents are considered overweight or obese.

docs.lead_paragraph: It's about freedom, not the fries.

headline.main: 'Freedom' Fries: Texas Repeals Ban on Deep Fryers in Schools
headline.print_headline: 'Freedom' Fries: Texas Repeals Ban on Deep Fryers in Schools

docs.snippet: It's about freedom, not the fries.

docs.lead_paragraph: Think of Audrey Hepburn, and your mind will likely conjure up an extraordinarily elegant woman in a boat-necked black dress, huge sunglasses, gloves to the elbow, and a chic updo.

headline.main: Hepburn's Son Recalls Mom's Life _ and Kitchen _ in New Book
headline.print_headline: Hepburn's Son Recalls Mom's Life _ and Kitchen _ in New Book

docs.lead_paragraph: Almost 24,000 Egyptian children have received school meals and rations for their families under a scheme to prevent youngsters in the poorest areas from dropping out of school and working, U.N. and EU officials said.

headline.main: U.N. Uses Food Aid to Fight Against Child Labor in Egypt
headline.print_headline: U.N. Uses Food Aid to Fight Against Child Labor in Egypt

docs.snippet: Almost 24,000 Egyptian children have received school meals and rations for their families under a scheme to prevent youngsters in the poorest areas from dropping out of school and working, U.N. and EU officials said.

docs.lead_paragraph: Michelle Obama and her daughters visited Milan's Duomo cathedral on Thursday, where an official traveling with her said they lit candles in memory of the victims of the shooting in South Carolina.

headline.main: Michelle Obama Lights Candles for US Shooting Victims
headline.print_headline: Michelle Obama Lights Candles for US Shooting Victims

docs.snippet: Michelle Obama and her daughters visited Milan's Duomo cathedral on Thursday, where an official traveling with her said they lit candles in memory of the victims of the shooting in South Carolina.
